headline: Bread Machine Monkey Bread
description: Here is a bread machine monkey bread recipe, though it can easily be done in the conventional muscle-building way.

video.description: See how to use your bread machine to make sweet monkey bread.
video.name: Monkey Bread II

name: Bread Machine Monkey Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the baking pan from the machine. Place yeast, flour, cinnamon, salt, white sugar, 2 tablespoons margarine, and water in the order recommended for the bread machine. Make sure that no liquid comes in contact with yeast. Select dough cycle and press start.
Transfer dough to a floured surface; knead 10 to 12 times. Set aside to rest.
Melt 1 cup margarine in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir in brown sugar and raisins until smooth. Remove from heat.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a Bundt or tube pan.

Cut dough into 1-inch chunks. Drop a chunk at a time into brown sugar mixture to thoroughly coat. Layer dough pieces loosely in the prepared pan, staggering layers, so you're plopping each dough chunk over a space between two below. Let rise in a warm, draft-free spot until dough is just over the top of the pan, 15 to 20 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cover the pan with a plate. Holding the plate and the pan with oven mitts, flip over both until bread slides out onto the plate. Serve warm.

review.reviewBody: Used classic white bread dough recipe from bread machine, only needed a fraction of the sauce, but absolutely delicious every time! That for the great recipe!
I used butter, not margarine. I plumped the saltana raisins ahead, and only used 2/3 cup. Melt in your mouth goodness. Fun to make with husband helping.

Best recipe for actual homemade monkey bread! If I cut the syrup ingredients, we run short, but as is, it makes a lot! Delicious in every way. 2021 I still make this recipe as written, and it’s delicious in every way. 6/2022 bake at 320 x 30 min in 2 bread loaf pans. Perfect!!
It is so good. I added 1 more teaspoon of cinnamon to dough also used cranraisins and pecans. Excellent!!!!!
Yumful! Totally a keeper - soft and delicious taste. I did add cinnamon to the brown sugar and margarine sauce mix. I also did not add raisins or nuts

favorite monkey bread recipe! make this regularly and I follow the tip on one of the top reviews that suggests melting the butter and brown sugar then pouring into the pan over the dough balls. super easy and support delicious. I omit the raisins and add chopped pecans instead.
I thought the video was very thorough and well done. Thank you!
Was super sweet. Too much sugar, I think. I’d try again and use less white sugar maybe.
Delicious! Nice and gooey in between the rolls. I added a pinch of clove, extra cinnamon, nutmeg, and allspice.
Made many times and love it! Great for parties or brunches!
Yes I will make it again
Delicious. I made this without a bread machine, and made a 1/3 batch in an air fryer.

Very Good. I used hand made method w/o bread machine. No raisins or nuts but was delicious. I agree the caramel mixture makes ALOT! You could get by making 1/2-3/4 what the recipe calls for. Very good and easy recipe!

Good recipe. One of the reviews said that it would spill over in the oven, so I put a baking sheet under it which caused it to not cook well on the bottom. It didn't spill over at all either. Follow the recipe!
Kids loved this
I have been wanting to make monkey bread and found this recipe. All I can say is this recipe was awful. I was being kind with 2 stars.
I made this with pecans instead of raisins. It was delicious!! A bread machine makes it so much easier! I will definately make this again!!

I made it exactly following the recipe just added a teaspoon of cinnamon to the butter/brown sugar mix. It was a huge hit at Christmas dinner I am definitely adding this to my favorites. It’s easy and quick to make and the caramel sauce when it’s warm is delicious. I also made a cream cheese icing to top it.

Thank-you for this recipe..It is so easy and delicious.I added marachino cherries & walnuts.The recipe calls for margarine but the instructions call for butter...I used the butter.This bread is sweet,sticky &,gooey,but ohhh!!sooo!! good.
When I reach the top of the Bundt pan, I pour some extra sauce on it

This came out absolutely unbelievably delicious! I followed the recipe to a T, didn't change a thing. I'm not sure how everyone else is ending up with too much sauce though. I almost didnt have enough!

I made this recipe exactly as the recipe called for and it was amazing! My husband is constantly asking me to make it again! I made the dough the night before and refrigerated it, then took it out in the morning about a half hour before baking it- makes for a much quicker and easier Sunday breakfast!
love it
Perfect soft dough, great rise. Didn't use raisins or nuts. Left in bread machine extra 20 minutes. Did not knead by hand.
Absolutely delicious! And I can sub ghee for the margarine for my lactose intolerant relatives and it still tastes wonderful.

Great recipe. I kept everything the same but used a pudding mold without the lid to give it a tower effect. I didn't pour any of the sauce on until I had filled my pudding mold halfway ( don't fill it to the top because the bread rises right over the mold in the oven. I made 2 towers and gave one to my neighbors who ate every drop in one sitting . Also a total hit with my husband and kid!! Definitely a keeper.
Made it according to directions using my bread machine. Came out perfectly. I did add a 1/4 dark rum to the brown sugar/margarine caramel sauce. Delicious!

WOW best Monkey Bread I've had. I used the bread machine on dough setting as suggested. I used a non-stick bundt pan, no grease needed. I added dry-toasted chopped pecans, and diced apples. And I added this caramel sauce recipe: 1 stick butter - melt in saucepan. Add 1 cup packed dark brown sugar, and 3 TBS heavy whipping cream. Wisk and simmer till sugar melts and it mixes together. Pour half into dough before going into the oven. Reserve the rest for drizzling as you serve! ~ Laura in CA

I liked the concept but there was too much butter, 1 cup was too much and I took some out before dipping the dough in it. I think the whole thing was overly sweet, and we like sweet, but this was too much. If I make it again I will tweak the recipe for less butter and sugar. One mistake I did make was I overcooked the butter and sugar and it didn't stick very good to the dough.

Great recipe. Fun to make. Couldn’t find my bundt pan; used my angel food cake pan instead. BIG mistake, butter and sugar leaked out and burned on the oven floor. Won’t make it again without a bundt pan.

Instead of melting butter and sugar and raisins for a sauce I rolled the dough into balls, then dipped them into butter and cinnamon sugar, alternately. I think maybe my sugar was too coarse, so next time I'd use a finer grain. The dough was good but it was a bit too sweet after adding cinnamon sugar and a bit of extra sauce.

The bread was fine but had a weird after-taste. it almost tasted like chemicals, but that's not the main reason why I rated this so low. As I was flipping the bread over onto the plate, right out of the oven, a bunch of the syrup came out and hit my leg. I ended up in Children's hospital urgent care with a second and slight third degree burn all down my thigh. If anyone plans on making this maybe let it cool for 15-20 minutes before you flip it. Having to go to the hospital is not worth "just out of the oven" bread.

My family loved this, even my non-sweets eating husband. I halved the recipe (sans raisins) and used a loaf pan (because I don't own a bundt pan), cooked as directed and it still turned out perfectly. I also did the last rise in the fridge overnight and took it out in the morning 30 min prior to baking so it would be ready asap for breakfast. I'm only giving four stars because it's annoying the recipe was written for bread machines... recipes should not be written for specialized and superfluous gadgets in my opinion. 
However, I'm really happy to have found a recipe that is an actual recipe and doesn't call for pre-packaged ingredients (pastry dough), and I really quite liked the very slightly cinnamony flavor of the dough. 
The only real change I made was pouring the melted sauce in the pan instead of dipping one by one...I tried the dipping and the sauce didn't seem to want to stick to the dough balls, but many of the other monkey bread recipes do pouring instead of dipping so I tried that and just allowed the excess to run off when flipped after it was done baking and it worked great. Much easier and less messy too, again, hence the four stars.

Great recipe. I've made it twice. Once I dipped all the chunks in the caramel mixture and once I put them in the pan and poured sauce over. It looks nicer and holds up better with pouring the sauce, but it's not nearly as yummy as when you dip each piece first. Also, put down foil in the oven. It expanded a lot in the oven and a few pieces broke loose and landed stickily on the oven floor. Love it. Real crowd pleaser.
I will make this again, but I would put the raisins in the dough. It took longer than 15 - 20 minutes to double in size.

I made one for my hubby and another one the next day for my Physical Therapists to say thank you. They both went over GREAT. Got comments like: best I've ever had, I'll just take this with me back to my office, or WOW, Thanks. Both of them were BIG hits!!

The first attempt I used my bundt pan which turned out to be too shallow, so the dough spilled over the sides a bit....not good presentation, but tasted good. Also the sugar/butter glaze was too runny. The next time I made it I stirred the butter/sugar glaze till melted then boiled it for a minute ; also used my angel food cake pan and it was MUCH more presentable and delicious! I will make it again with pecans and glazed cherries and boil the glaze for 11/2 -2 minutes.

Very good but did as one other suggested. 1/3 butter mixture poured into bottom of bunt pan, layer of dough mixture, pour more butter mixture, rest of dough (rolled into grape size balls) and rest of butter mixture. No mess at all. We all agreed it had a funny taste. Will try this with my cinnamon roll dough recipe.
Excellent recipe!! We make this every Christmas morning!! We use butter only but other than that follow the recipe to a "T"!! Just excellent!! Thanks for a family favorite!
It was ok but way to much brown sugar/sauce. I used my mixer as others and the bread was good.
Way too hot! The top of my monkey bread burned within 12 minutes. Should probably be around 325. Also, like another reviewer said, to much cinnamon mixture. Otherwise the bread was tasty.
It is so good. My grandma makes it all the time. It is the bomb.
Looking for a from scratch version and tried this out. Much better flavor. Prepared thru the place in the pan step the night before then took out to rise next morning. Tastes so good.
it was amazing and delicious
I make the dough from scratch and sprinkle in chocolate chips when layering it but this is the best recipe for the dough

I made this today. My bf wanted them for breakfast Sunday for Thanksgiving. . I tried the recipe. He loves them. I think they are ok. I don't have a bread maker so I followed the advice of another commenter. The bread texture itself was phenomenal. Light airy and a great crust. I personally found the sauce to be lacking in flavor but my bf and his coworkers loved it. Note : it took about 30 min for dough to rise in pan. Still a good recipe however
This has been my go to monkey bread recipe for about 8 years now. I make it at least once a year, probably more. I get requests for it at work and when we have guests visit at home.

I wanted to make monkey bread in the morning. To prevent separation issues like some noted, I melted the butter and sugar together and boiled for a good 3-4 minutes, whisking constantly, for it to come together like a caramel sauce. I stuck the pan in the fridge to cool down fast. Once the temp cooled to 115F (safe for the yeast), I just rolled the dough balls (made the night before btw) in the sauce. Since many reviewers said they had lots of extra sauce leftover using the original recipe's dough, I upped the dough by 50%. As a result, I ended up using ALL the sauce but I prefer a more saucy monkey bread. Next time, I will make a tad more caramel to drizzle IN BETWEEN each dough layer. Thank you for the recipe!

Requested repeatedly after I made it. I use my bread machine for the dough and throw my raisons or dates into the dough so they are beaten into the dough and you get the flavour without the texture. My family does not love cooked raisons. I make my sauce with double the butter and double the brown sugar and I put a splash of vanilla and corn syrup. Sometimes I'll put maple syrup in too. I coat each piece and pour the rest over the top before baking. Great dessert to bring to group events.
Caution! Your family and friends will beg you to make more..

You made this way too complicated. First, I let the dough rise for awhile to get some more "yeasty" flavor in a buttered bowl. Then cut up the dough into pieces and put back into the bowl. Add some raisins and walnut pieces and shake it up, then pour the butter/brown sugar mixture on top and stir. Pour the whole mess into a pan and bake!
Used store bought frozen bread dough and golden raisins, added cinnamon. Yumm!

I am very happy to have found this recipe! I make monkey bread often and have always been lazy and have just used the tube of biscuit dough from the grocery store. Believe it or not my husband and I recently moved to a country that does not have tubes of dough! I searched for dough recipes using a bread machine and came across this recipe. I love it! It is tasty, easy to make, and takes no more effort than cracking open a tube of dough! Thank you for sharing. Someone in Afghanistan is now making monkey bread...

Made 6 servings in a 6 servings XL muffin tin. Added finely chopped pecans and used whey instead of water. I don't have a bread machine so the directions were lost to me. I suggest 2 risings, which I think the directions call for if you had a bread machine. With 1 rising, the bread felt denser than normal.

The flavor was good. However the dough was too loose and I had to add about 1/2 more of flour. I didn't care for the process of dipping the dough balls in hot sugar and butter mixture. Almost burned my fingers.
I followed this recipe to a T..and my dough didn't rise. At All. And no my yeast didn't touch any liquid or salt. Very disappointing..
This recipe was delicious, the kids devoured the whole thing in under 10 minutes! Next time I'm going to add more cinnamon and vanilla to the sauce.
we added a sprinkling of cinnamon and brown sugar to the bottom and sides of the greased bunt pan which added a little extra delicious gooey topping when done! awesome!
Just love it! I like to make sure the edges are well done, so the bread isn't soggy!
Yum!

I love this recipe! There's nothing id change! You can always use more or omit the raisins! I also pour the remaining brown sugar mixture over the top before I bake it, to make it extra gooey! Perfect for people to have a sweet treat, but only what they want to take. Love it!

It may be messy but here's what I say....a messy baker is a happy baker....a messy kitchen is a happy kitchen....it was delicious and easy to clean...just soak everything in hot water right after you use it.....don't let the butter/brown sugar mixture sit in the pan after you've used it all.....cause it crystallizes on to the pot.....I speak from experience!!!!

wonderful recipe, cannot get enough stars for easyness, quickness, gooeyness... we had company for dinner and I set the bread machine timer to have it ready by the time I came home; 10 minutes to dip the little dough balls in butter/sugar mixture (yes, a trifle too much, you can cut the amount or drizzle it on the finished product before baking). I skipped the raisins and nuts, but made it pretty with candied cherries and popped it into the oven: ready in 20 minutes, just about the time to put the finishing touches to the dinner and serve it. Then it went on the table nicely warm; ok, there is the hot and messy sauce issue, so you need to be careful when you put it upside down, but all in all it was a smash!
I used chopped pecans instead of raisins. I also added a handful of pecans to the bottom of the bundt pan. It baked beautiful and the taste was amazingly perfect.

I use my break maker for the dough and love to switch it up by putting different things besides raisins (always measure out to a cup). Sometimes I use chocolate chips or add nuts. Definitely a hit and people are always impressed!

This recipe is a good start and there are many different ways to make this. However the changes I made were similar to making Parker House Rolls - by using milk (not water) , 1 large beaten egg, and bread flour. I also added 2 tsp of almond extract, and tsp each of cinnamon and cardamom. I also used 1 stick of melted butter in the batter.
When the dough rose I melted the other stick of butter with the brown sugar, and added 1 tsp of ground ginger and 1 tsp of vanilla extract.
This bread is sticky sweet and hard to put down. 

I think the next time I make this I'll try it with rose water, grated orange peel and all the other ingredients used in baklava.

Made dough and sauce the day before. The next morning I took them out of the fridge and let them rise for about 45 min. and then cooked them as directed. I made them in a round cake pan. They were wonderful.

Because I was unable to use my bread machine to make my dough I did not realize that the dough setting on it let it rise for 58 minutes. I will definitely try this recipe again and let the dough rise for 58 minutes before making the balls. It was good just way more dense than expected but of course that was due to the lack of rising time! I will also take out the raisins as the rest of my family did not like them. (I thought they were great but I must please the masses!) This recipe mixed up well in my kitchen aid mixer using a dough hook. After checking the cycle for my dough setting on my bread machine I know it needs to mix for 24 minutes then "rest"/rise for another 58 minutes. Just in case anyone else wants to try it without the bread machine.
This recipe soooo delicious i made it for me and my husband ..it taste just like the cinnabon backery ..loved it ..
Excellent!

Great recipe!! Turned out awesome, although I had to move it in the oven mid bake bc the top was too close to the top of the oven... I did sub in whole wheat flour for white so needed almost a 1/4 cup more water than the recipe called for. I also added an extra tsp of cinnamon to the bread and a 1/2tsp to the glaze. I also put a cookie sheet on the bottom rack to catch all the dribbles.
I think it should be called Pig a Bread cause that's what we made of ourselves eating it. So good! I used raisins and pecans. I'll definitely make this again - maybe Xmas morning.

I used this recipe as a guideline to utilize some left over bread dough. I grind my own wheat, so I did it manually as opposed to a bread machine, which I don't own. Once my dough was ready, I simply cut into squares and rolled into balls, dipped them in the butter mixture made with chopped pecans (no raisins... yuk!), sprinkled a raw sugar and cinnamon mixture on top, and baked In a glass pie pan. Absolutely delicious!!! I highly recommend this recipe! It wasn't that messy at all and would be hard to mess up. So many variations can be used! Enjoy!
Well, it fell apart on me >.
Really good recipe!! Before I put the balls into the pan, I roled them in a little buter and cinimin sugar. My family loved it. So good!

Wow is this good! And the house smells amazing! We did not include nuts as we are usually not nut people with deserts. However, once munching on it, I could see where they would have been good. Wonderful flavor! Great using the bread machine to help with the work. I love the biscuits in a tube for some things, but this is much better. Made it exactly as described but added a pinch of cinnamon to the butter sauce.

This is the best monkey bread I have ever had! I love throwing the ingredients into my bread machine and having great dough to work with later. Coating each piece with the delicious butter and brown sugar mixture ensures that every piece is to die for. I make this for my own family often as well as giving it to family and friends. It is a hit everywhere it goes!

Made this with the bread machine, but the dough came out too sticky. I added more flour while I kneaded it and it could have probably used 1/4 cup to 1/2 cup more flour. I halved the butter and brown sugar as suggested by other reviewers, which was just enough to coat all the dough balls. The glaze came out nice & gooey, but the dough was too light & airy for my taste. I prefer a chewier texture. Next time I will use the dough from "Clone of a Cinnabon" to make Monkey Bread.
frozen ones are better.

I used wheat flour and just add ten minutes to baking on 375 and it was DELICIOUS!! I added pecans and its a great addition to the monkey bread! I would totally recommend this recipe if you're doing monkey bread for a first time!
We love this recipe at our house, just as-is. Thank you, Darren, Debbie and Joshua.

This is a pretty awesome recipe. I have been looking for a monkey bread recipe that does not call for refrigerator biscuits and this is perfect. I do not have a bundt pan so I used a muffin pan instead (only cooked this for about 15 minutes) and popped 3 or 4 of the chunks of dough into each greased muffin cup. However, I will definitely have to get a bundt pan now that I know how wonderful this recipe is and try it that way next!
This is absolutely delicious! I did it using the dough recipe for the "clone of a cinnabon" and added peeled apple chunks in between the layers. My kids devoured it within minutes!

I used my Cuisinart food processor instead of the bread machine to mix and knead the dough. I also proofed the yeast in 1/2 c water before adding the liquid ingredients to the mixer. I omitted the raisins and used pecan pieces in the dough and pecan halves in the bottom of the pan. When I made the butter sugar syrup I also added cinnamon (maybe 1/2T) for extra flavor. My Monkey Bread turned out exactly as I like it with just the right amount of gooey, sticky sauce and pecans throughout. I loved this recipe and will definitely make it again as it was easy. From start to finish it only took 2 hours to make these and they were wonderful.

You saved our Christmas! My mother was making Monkey Bread as a tradition but forgot to pick up the packaged dough. I couldn't find a store open late on Christmas Eve so I looked for a way to make it from scratch. Our family already loved the version using packaged dough, but this recipe kicked it up a notch and they all loved it! I made a couple of adjustments to make it *easier.* Made the dough by hand (no bread machine) and it was easy to work with it. Let rest for about 50-60 minutes until doubled. Punched down and rolled out the dough and cut it into 1" pieces with a pizza cutter. Melted the butter by itself. Placed the brown sugar and 1 c. nuts (omitted raisins) into a shallow bowl. Dunked the dough pieces into the butter and then moved to the sugar mixture; rolled til coated and then placed into the angel food pan. Poured the remaining sugar/nuts into the butter and then poured over the top of dough. Let rest another 20 minutes. Baked for 30 minutes. Gone before I knew it!
Tastes divine! Want to try it with cranberries or blueberries as well as apples. I do think next time I make it I will make only half the sauce as I had enough for two doughs.

Really good !-- will wait to cool about 15 minutes next time before flipping on to a plate. The sugar ran all over the place. I did not have raisins on hand but I did use dried currants, which were good as well. I think I will cut down the cinnamon in the dough just a little bit, maybe add it to the sugar/butter to go on the outside instead? This did not last long in my house. My husband is an addict when it comes to sticky buns/sweet rolls!!

I used butter instead of margarine, and it tasted awesome! I will try with margarine too, just to see which flavor we prefer. So easy to make! I thought when the dough came out of the bread machine that surely this was not enough dough for a whole bundt pan--but sure enough, it filled that puppy right up! Great recipe, will definitely make again!

Awesome! My first time making it, tasted as good as it looked. My husband ate so much of it I thought he was going to turn into a monkey! I added pecan halves, other than that everything else was the same. Thank you soo much for this one!
Very tasty! We've made it twice and I'm sure we'll make it again!
Good, easy and inexpensive. A Keeper.
Wow. That was amazing. Ooey, gooey...perfect!!
Gorgeous!!!!!!! I've no chance of being thin with recipes as amazing as this....... oh well! Thankyou!!
Yumm.
I absolutely loved this recipe!!!! I can't stop making it!!! so fun!
Amazing. I made half the sauce and it came out super gooey and sweet. Will make again.

I wanted to like this, I really did, but I just couldn't. I found the sauce to be the major problem- the recipe makes too much, and with so much butter it ends up far too rich and cloyingly sweet. Not wanting to waste any, I poured some directly into the pan both before and after dunking all the dough balls. While it makes for a beautiful presentation, there's just so much it's overpowering. Also, the bread the recipe makes seems to be too delicate to stand up to such a heavy sauce. I'm sorry but I will not be using this recipe again.

I'm 42 and I just now found monkey bread...all those wasted years :) This was yummy. I added 1/2 tsp nutmeg to the bread machine ingredients and 1/4 cup walnuts to the brown sugar mixture and it turned out fantastic. Can't wait to try again.
Great recipe, tastes great.
